title: How to take a great picture - Carolina Molinari

multiple-choice.question: What is the main purpose of learning how cameras work with light?

options.label: A
options.text: To improve the camera's ability to capture images

options.label: B
options.text: To understand the variables that determine exposure

options.label: C
options.text: To replace the human eye with a camera

multiple-choice.question: What is the aperture, and what happens when it is made big?

options.label: A
options.text: The aperture is the light meter, and a big aperture will give more light

options.label: B
options.text: The aperture is the hole that light passes through, and a big aperture will give more light but decrease the sharpness of the photo

options.label: C
options.text: The aperture is the shutter speed, and a big aperture will give more light but decrease the sharpness of the photo

options.label: D
options.text: The aperture is the ISO sensitivity, and a big aperture will give more light but decrease the sharpness of the photo

multiple-choice.question: What is shallow depth of field, and when is it useful?

options.label: A
options.text: Shallow depth of field is when the entire image is in focus, and it is useful for portraits

options.label: B
options.text: Shallow depth of field is when the focus point is sharp, and the background is blurry, and it is useful for portraits

options.label: C
options.text: Shallow depth of field is when the focus point is blurry, and the background is sharp, and it is useful for landscapes

options.label: D
options.text: Shallow depth of field is when the entire image is blurry, and it is useful for nothing

options.label: A
options.text: To add more light to the scene

options.label: C
options.text: To steady the shot and prevent motion blur

options.label: A
options.text: Light painting is a technique used to capture motion blur, and it is used for sports photography

options.label: B
options.text: Light painting is a technique used to draw in the dark with a torch or the light of a cell phone, and it is used for creative photography

options.label: C
options.text: Light painting is a technique used to add more light to the scene, and it is used for landscapes

options.label: D
options.text: Light painting is a technique used to capture sharp images, and it is used for portraits

multiple-choice.question: What is ISO sensitivity, and what happens when it is increased?

options.label: A
options.text: ISO sensitivity is the amount of light that the camera can capture, and increasing it will give noisier images

options.label: B
options.text: ISO sensitivity is the speed of the shutter, and increasing it will give sharper images

options.label: C
options.text: ISO sensitivity is the aperture, and increasing it will give more light but decrease the sharpness of the photo

options.label: D
options.text: ISO sensitivity is the light meter, and increasing it will give more accurate readings

multiple-choice.question: What is the light meter, and what is its purpose?

options.label: A
options.text: The light meter is a device that measures the speed of the shutter, and it is used to determine the correct exposure

options.label: B
options.text: The light meter is a device that measures the amount of light that the camera can capture, and it is used to determine the correct exposure

options.label: C
options.text: The light meter is a device that measures the aperture, and it is used to determine the correct exposure

options.label: D
options.text: The light meter is a device that measures the ISO sensitivity, and it is used to determine the correct exposure

multiple-choice.question: What is the main purpose of using a low ISO sensitivity?

options.label: B
options.text: To increase the speed of the shutter

options.label: C
options.text: To decrease the amount of noise in the image

options.label: D
options.text: To require more light to register a photo

multiple-choice.question: What is the main purpose of using a high ISO sensitivity?

options.label: B
options.text: To increase the speed of the shutter

options.label: C
options.text: To decrease the amount of noise in the image

options.label: D
options.text: To require less light to register a photo

options.label: A
options.text: To improve the camera's ability to capture images

options.text: To understand the variables that determine exposure

options.label: C
options.text: To replace the human eye with a camera

options.label: D
